poem:
Title: "Ode to the BT Tower"

In every brick, the dial tone hums,
its fingers pointing, the commerce of sky.
Upon verdigris lips, £275m.
A tower's tale swirling in hotel linens -
MCR whispers across the ocean.
Splendid in observance, silent bell toll,
4,000 eyes each day recording history,
now pay to sleep under its stern sentinel.
Life, forever preserved in Grade II aspiration.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Share your memories of the BT Tower The BT Tower is to be converted into an upmarket hotel. BT Group said the deal with MCR Hotels would still preserve the Grade II-listed building for the future. In the 1960s, 4,000 people a day would visit the observation". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
